resources.string: Please do not steal from me, I am poor.

You will be guided by several famous mathematicians through their individual groups of levels called 'epics'. Each epic is split into 3 sections with 9 levels each. Your goal is to collect up to 3 stars in each level by getting the highest score you can! The more stars you collect, the more levels you unlock! 

Each level has an operation (ie. add or subtract) and a score type (i.e. points or character faces). They are explained before the game when you see them for the first time. You can always press the back button to pause a level and look at the level's explanation if you need a reminder of how they work in the future. In this pause screen, you can also get the level's info which has a general description of the level and what scores you need to collect each star. 

The rest you will learn as you go. Well, what are you waiting for? Go meet Albert Einstein and start playing his first level!

Hello! My name is Albert Einstein. I am well known for the work I did to explain gravity, how objects behave at speeds approaching the speed of light, and how mass and energy are related. In my level set, I will be guiding you through addition and subtraction challenges.
Glass - break by including tile in sequence with glass in front of it. Note: Tiles cleared by powers will break the glass.
Blocks - smash by including tile in sequence that is adjacent to it.
